channel.title: ruby on rails on Daniel Pritchett's Homepage
channel.description: Recent content in ruby on rails on Daniel Pritchett's Homepage

item.title: I'm Guest Posting on Spree and Neo4j for GraphStory.com
item.description: I’ve recently been working with some friends at a local startup called Graph Story. They provide a hosted graph database solution using Neo4j. They are looking to build up some introductory content to help developers get started with graph databases, so I wrote them a series of posts. Here’s the first in the series: Graph Kit for Ruby Part 1: Letâ€™s Build a Recommendation Engine for a Spree Store.

item.title: Favorite Ruby console tweaks to make my job easier - pry edition
item.description: My current project involves a lot of data coming in from a legacy system. Luckily I have the production web site of the legacy system available to compare against at any time. These two things are helping me out a lot for spot checking. I put them both in my ~/.pryrc file so that I always have them locally and I don’t have to pollute shared codebases with my pet tools.
